t: Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying:
“Son of man, how is the wood of the vine better*i than any other wood, the vine branch which is among the trees of the forest?
Is wood taken from it to make any object? Or can men*i make a peg from it to hang any vessel on?
Instead, it is thrown into the fire for fuel; the fire devours both ends of it, and its middle is burned. Is it useful for any*i work?
Indeed, when it was whole, no object could be made from it. How much less will it be useful for any*i work when the fire has devoured it, and it is burned?
“Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s ‘Like the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so I will give up the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
and I will set My face against them. They will go out from one*i fire, but another*i fire shall devour them. Then you shall know that I am*i the Lord,*s when I set My face against them.
Thus I will make the land desolate, because they have persisted in unfaithfulness,’ says the Lord God.”*s
